lexUnit.name: slap.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: hit or strike with the palm of one's hand or a flat object.

sentence.text: ` Oh you be quiet , " Sarah slapped him on the arm and he spilled some ice-cream on the table .
Instinctively , Joan reacts to Victor 's kick by slapping the boy on the back of the leg .
If someone slaps your left cheek then you slap his right , only harder .
On another day I provoked him in some way and he slapped my cheek .
The Frenchman slapped Killion hard on both cheeks and ran out into the street .
Lennon slapped her sharply across the face .
Next minute Perdita had slapped him across the face .
The other day he slapped Liam across the face and got mad at me when I complained .
But Marika had a really fiery temper , and the last time that happened she slapped Evelyn hard on the face , shouted something at her about being supposed to be her friend , and stormed off .
When Mr Newton arrived at Clifford 's home , he had slapped his wife across the face a number of times .
He tried to slap Jeane Russell with his left hand , but she backed out of the way and just laughed at him .
I said no ! " she screamed , slapping at his hand blindly as she finally managed to drag her bruised mouth from his .
She slapped him hard .
With a snarl , Fox spun around and slapped him , harder than necessary .
But he slapped him so hard that blood trickled down Rooney 's face .
` Because you ca n't face the truth that we are falling in love yet again ? " he suggested so calmly that she wanted to slap him hard for his change of mood .
He squawked and flapped his arms , and she slapped his leg .
In October 1982 she finally called the police after he slapped her across the mouth , cutting her lip .
One of the escorts slapped me across the mouth .
She stared up at Carrie , slapping her forehead with the palm of her hand .
Patrick slapped her knee sharply .
He slapped me on the shoulder .
A crew member slapped his shoulder vigorously .
He tried to slap Killion on the shoulder and missed , and ended up on the floor .
Far as I remember he called me a nasty name and I slapped his wrist . "
He was also sensible enough to realise that if he made a sexual advance to Blanche she would slap him across his stubbly moustache .
He was walking off when I reached out , grabbed him again and slapped him across the head .
I remember one day she slapped me across the jaw .
The policeman who had kicked me in the groin began to slap Russell around the head .
She slapped his behind with blistering whacks until she became aware of the pain in her hand and wrist .
` One man ! " screeched Lin Foh , and slapped his sides in exasperation .
Last night the woman , who did not wish to be named , said : ` I 'm really furious , I 'd just love to slap him on his fat chops .
The hand promptly slapped her on the neck , and she leapt into the air with shock and surprise ; but she was even more surprised when she was offered more feed .
Dr Frome slapped himself violently on the thigh .
A POLICEMAN who slapped a prisoner twice during a struggle at Fort William police station was jailed for 30 days at Fort William Sheriff Court yesterday .
She could easily have slapped her for that remark , which was silly really , but nonetheless that was how she felt .
Lisa felt like slapping him for his sarcasm and his arrogance .
Moustaine made me stand up and slapped me across the eyes with his leather gloves .
He was also sensible enough to realise that if he made a sexual advance to Blanche she would slap him across his stubbly moustache .
The policeman who had kicked me in the groin began to slap Russell around the head .
` I should slap you for that remark but you 're not worth soiling my hands with .
Frau Hoflin fought an overwhelming desire to slap her daughter .
He slapped her , swiftly and casually , his hand coming back to cover her mouth in case she might cry out .
Lee wanted to slap them .
Carmella slapped his knee again .
She was on him , scratching , slapping , punching , grabbing his hair , spitting on him , screaming at him .
She slapped , brushed , shook , mended , darned .
